alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 01 at 3:24PM EDT until May 02 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 19 inches. The lowest snow accumulations will occur close to Lake Superior and well inland around Arnold. The greatest snow accumulations, up to an additional 2 feet, will occur in the high terrain to the southeast of L`anse and to the west and northwest of Negaunee. Northwest winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Baraga, Marquette and Alger Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible due to slushy snow accumulations on roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening and morning commutes today and Tuesday. With heavy wet snow collecting on trees and powerlines, the strong will cause tree damage and power outages. The power outages could become widespread. The snow will be difficult to move.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
